item.title: Instrument Framework v1.5.16.82
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.5.16.82
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 17 Aug 2020 11:01:14 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Knows how to communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a DSC database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Currently provided by National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM), however a cross-platform protocol is developed using 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.5.16.81]
- Issue #22: convert data to variant before flatten to string; unflatten string to variant before convert to data
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.11.5.31
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.11.5.31
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Thu, 30 Jul 2020 18:20:57 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.11.5.31]
- Build for LV2019
- Disable Save function

[2.11.4.30]
- Build with Instrument Framework v1.5.15.77
- Improve error handling in lockinDAQ process
- Fix issue with reset function

[2.11.3.29]
- Fix issue if multiple reference frequencies are selected the output is not calculated correctly
- Fix issue with gain in AI simulation mode not being configured properly

[2.11.2.28]
- Max Fs mode does not update decimation setting automatically

[2.11.1.26]
- Fix issue where exe would not shut down properly (#4)

[2.11.0.24]
- Update the way the user choosing the sampling frequency (Fs) and number of samples (N) (issues #7 #26)
- Manual: user's choice
- Auto: Fs = N*F1
- max Fs: Fs = maximum, decimation = 100, LP filter = Fs/100/4, N = Fs/refresh rate
- Fix issues where incorrect results would be given if more than one demodulation frequency is choses (issue #27)
- New AI simulation modes:
- HW simulation configured by MAX
- AI = noise*AO
- AI = simulate electron waveguide (https://github.com/levylabpitt/Multichannel-Lockin#simulation-mode)
- AO1 = source voltage
- AO2 = gate voltage
- AI1 = drain current
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.4.13.39
item.description:
Product: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.4.13.39
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 28 Jul 2020 15:50:07 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Program for logging PPMS status to the DSC. Provides a UI and API for controlling the magnet field, temperature, and rotator angle (for PPM2)

Release Notes: [1.4.13.39]
- build w/ Instrument.lvclass v1.5.15.77
- installer now adds a start menu shortcut
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instruments v1.5.13.75
item.description:
Product: Instruments v1.5.13.75
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Wed, 22 Jul 2020 16:40:51 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework for LabVIEW based on JKI SMOs, developed for the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following responsibilities:

- Knows how to communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a DSC database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Currently provided by National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM), however a cross-platform protocol is developed using 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.

Release Notes: [1.5.13.75]
- Remote Control (STM) now supports multiple open connections
item.dc:creator: Levylab
